titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Albert Winslow Barker (1874-1947) was an artist and lithographer. He was a graduate of the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts, Haverford, and the University of Pennsylvania. After teaching at the School of Industrial Arts in Philadelphia and serving as Director of Art Education in Wilmington Delaware, Barker devoted himself to the practice of lithography.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Bryn Mawr College: John Taylor Arms papers and Bolton Brown papers; Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution: Microfilm of this Barker collection.
